result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. BRETT T STANDKE

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on November 29, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Letter to the defendant dated 11/03/2022 re: Court appointed Atty Jeanne Zamzow. Defendant is to pay $50 per month commencing 11/30/2022 for court appointed attorney fees.
Order on Appointment of an Attorney (Atty Jeanne Zamzow)
Order on Appointment of an Attorney (Atty Jeanne Zamzow)
Letter from the defendant regarding counsel w/attachments for court appointed counsel (confidential)

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant BRETT T STANDKE in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant if an attorney was appointed what he could pay. Defendant states he can pay $50 per month. Court will appoint an attorney and orders defendant to pay $50 per month commencing the end of November. Court goes over the defendant's address. Defendant confirms, address is correct. Court informs Clerk to file the documents the defendant submitted and make them confidential.

NOT ON THE RECORD  Defendant BRETT T STANDKE in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he applied for the public defender's office but doesn't qualify. Defendant would like to apply for a court appointed attorney. Defendant states he'd be able to pay $50 a month. Court notes bond has been posted and the Court may consider allowing defendant to use that as a retainer. Court instructs defendant how to apply for court appointed counsel. Court sets Status Hearing for October 31, 2022 at 3:15 PM

Status hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Status hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

9:40 AM Defendant BRETT T STANDKE in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes defendant has spoken to at least one attorney. Court grants defendant more time to find an attorney. 

Court adjourned: 9:41 AM

Adjourned initial appearances set September 21, 2022 at 2:30 PM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:31 AM Defendant BRETT T STANDKE in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he is getting an attorney. Court notes bond has been set? Court sets for Adjourned Initial Appearance on September 6, 2022 at 9:30 AM

Court adjourned at 9:32 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

No Contact with the victim AS or her residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
Bail Bond Deposit Acknowledgement

No Contact with the victim AS or her residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

1:00 PM Defendant Brett Standke in court, in custody and via video.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court has reviewed a probable cause statement and finds probable cause. ADA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $5,000 cash bond and conditions of: No Contact with the victim AS or her residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Court sets for Initial Appearance on August 2, 2022 at 9:30 AM.
